result.execSummary:
The defendant Shiloh M Dicosimo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Interfere w/ Child Custody, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.31(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall submit a payment with amount deemed appropriate by the agent on a monthly basis.
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Defendant shall maintain full time employment.  Should defendant become unemployed he shall apply at 20 businesses/month that are hiring and file work search affidavits.
No contact with A.K.L.V. DOB: 2/9/15. Do not engage  in any daycare or supervisory of any children unless approved by agent.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup. 
Pay supervisory fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample by calling the Work Release Unit  at 920-232-1915 or 920-232-1919 WITHIN 72 HOURS OF SENTENCING to set up an appointment.   The Work Release Units hours are 8:00 am-4:00 pm/Monday thru Friday. Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats. 946.52.  
Take medications prescribed by physician.
Compy with all treatmentment recommendations by doctor or psychiatrist.

timeConds.notes:
consecutive. Huber granted, if in compliance with jail facility regulations.  Defendant shall report to the Work Release Unit (M-F/7:30 am to 3:30 pm), within 72 hours of sentence date with a copy of the minute sheet and the completed GPS application to establish report date for serving sentence.  Report date shall be within 60 days of sentence date.  Huber shall be revoked for failure to report and a warrant shall be authorized.

12/22/2016: Pursuant to hearing held on 12/26/2016, court stays remainder of jail term (42 days). That time can be used at the discretion of the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
